title: 2017 Predictions: Calibration Results
summary:
Key ideas:
- The author made 105 predictions for 2017 in various categories.
- The author scores his predictions at the end of the year and shares his accuracy.
- The author identified a tendency to overestimate how well personal affairs will go and underestimate the state of the US economy.

Key learnings:
- The author was 89% accurate on 80% probability predictions and 96% accurate on 90% probability predictions.
- The author's predictions about major events, such as no major earthquake in the US or North Korea's government surviving, were fairly accurate.
- The author had trouble with personal predictions, such as completing a long FAQ or hitting savings targets.

Key questions:
- How can the author improve his personal predictions?
- Can the author improve his predictions about the US economy?
- What predictions will the author make for 2018?
